cell

Class Boss

  • java.lang.Object
    • cell.Entity
      • cell.Projectile
        • cell.Boss

  • public class Boss
extends Projectile
    This data class is used to store the attributes of the boss of the game. Features of Version 4.0: This class was created to have a class construtor to create the Object, and a getBounds method to check what the perimeter of the Boss is. Time spent on this class: 5 min.
    Version:
    5.0, June 12, 2014
    Author:
    Salar Hosseini & Sophia Weng

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Boss()
      This is the class constructor is used to create this Object and call the super class' construtor to define the data fields that need to be defined in the super class with them.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.awt.Rectangle getBounds()
      This method is used to return the perimeter of the boss.

      • Methods inherited from class cell.Projectile

        getMoveX2, getMoveY2, setMoveX2, setMoveY2

      • Methods inherited from class cell.Entity

        getX, getY, setX, setY

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Boss

        public Boss()
        This is the class constructor is used to create this Object and call the super class' construtor to define the data fields that need to be defined in the super class with them. In other words, the x and y position are set for the boss.

    • Method Detail

      • getBounds

        public java.awt.Rectangle getBounds()
        This method is used to return the perimeter of the boss.
        Overrides:
        getBounds in class Projectile
        Returns:
        Rectangle The rectangle returned is a representation of an imaginary rectangle around the boss which is used to check for collision.
